document_data.name: Turami
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Turami''' were an ethnic group of humans who made up the primary population of [[Turmish]].

{{quote|''The measure of a man's worth can be seen in the cut of his beard.''|Old Turmish saying}}
document_data.Description: Turami had flat faces with mahogany skin tones. Their hair was curly, and they tended towards muscular and tall builds. The Turami of [[Turmish]] were known to be tall and beautiful.<ref>
document_data.Language: [[Turmic]] was the language of the Turami. They employed the [[Thorass alphabet]] in their writings, which they learned from trade with the [[Calishite]]s and [[Chondathan]]s.
document_data.History: The Turami were native to the region around the [[Alamber Sea]], but they were displaced by the migrating [[Mulan]] tribes after the fall of [[Imaskar]] in {{Yearlink|-2488}}. They came to settle in the area around [[Alagh√¥n]] and founded the nation of Turmish in {{Yearlink|-37}}.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The [[Methwood]] was said to contain the ruins of a city of the Turami from the time of [[Imaskar]].
